Uses of Package
org.springframework.aop.framework

Packages that use org.springframework.aop.framework
org.springframework.aop.framework Package containing Spring's basic AOP infrastructure, compliant with the AOP Alliance interfaces. 
org.springframework.transaction.interceptor AOP-based solution for declarative transaction demarcation.  
 

Classes in org.springframework.aop.framework used by org.springframework.aop.framework
AbstractMethodPointcut
          Abstract convenience superclass for implementations of DynamicMethodPointcut or StaticMethodPointcut.
AopConfigException
          Exception that gets thrown on illegal AOP configuration arguments.
DefaultProxyConfig
          Superclass for AOP Proxy configuration objects.
IntroductionInterceptor
          Subinterface of MethodInterceptor that allows additional interfaces to be implemented by the interceptor, and available via a proxy using that interceptor.
MethodPointcut
          Interface to be implemented by objects that can cause conditional invocation of an Interceptor depending on the method, arguments and attributes passed.
ProxyConfig
          Interface to be implemented by classes that hold the configuration of a factory of AOP proxies.
ProxyInterceptor
          Interface to be implemented by interceptors that have a proxy target.
StaticMethodPointcut
          Interface to be implemented by objects that can cause conditional invocation of an Interceptor depending on the method, and attributes passed.
 

Classes in org.springframework.aop.framework used by org.springframework.transaction.interceptor
AopConfigException
          Exception that gets thrown on illegal AOP configuration arguments.
DefaultProxyConfig
          Superclass for AOP Proxy configuration objects.
MethodPointcut
          Interface to be implemented by objects that can cause conditional invocation of an Interceptor depending on the method, arguments and attributes passed.
ProxyConfig
          Interface to be implemented by classes that hold the configuration of a factory of AOP proxies.
